one_liner: This technique uses electrooculography signals to detect alcohol intoxication levels in individuals.
how_it_works: Electrooculography (EOG) signals are collected from subjects wearing smart glasses while they are under the influence of alcohol. These signals are preprocessed to eliminate noise, and relevant features are extracted for analysis. A machine learning model is then trained to classify the state of intoxication, allowing for real-time detection of whether a subject is intoxicated or sober.

steps: 1. Collect electrooculography signals from subjects wearing smart glasses.
2. Preprocess the signals to remove noise and artifacts.
3. Extract relevant features from the processed signals.
4. Train a machine learning model using labeled data (intoxicated vs. sober).
5. Validate the model using a separate test dataset.
6. Deploy the model for real-time detection of intoxication.
algorithm.input_format: Electrooculography signals from smart glasses (time series data).
algorithm.output_format: Classification of the subject's intoxication state (intoxicated or sober).

parameters.name: sampling_rate
parameters.effect: Higher rates may improve signal quality but increase data processing requirements.

parameters.name: feature_set
parameters.effect: Changing features can affect model accuracy and detection capability.

complexity.practical_note: Real-world performance may vary based on environmental factors and sensor quality.

use_when: Developing safety features for autonomous vehicles
Creating wearable technology for health monitoring
avoid_when: Low-budget projects with limited sensor capabilities
Applications requiring high precision in non-biometric contexts

common_mistakes: Neglecting to preprocess signals properly, leading to inaccurate results.
Using an insufficient feature set that does not capture relevant data.
Failing to validate the model with a diverse test dataset.

strengths: Can be integrated into wearable technology.
weaknesses: Dependent on the quality of EOG signals.
May require user consent for data collection.
Performance can be affected by external factors like lighting.

compared_to.verdict: Use EOG detection for continuous monitoring; breathalyzers are better for one-time checks.
